source_sentence: 觀自在菩薩化身蘘麌哩曳童女
translation: Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva's transformation body, the wild stag-ripe girl
Sutra of the Dhāraṇī for Eliminating Poison and Harm

source_sentence: 開府儀同三司特進試鴻臚卿肅國
translation: Hongxing Qing Suguo, Specially Advanced Examination of the Third Secretary of the Kaifu Ritual

source_sentence: 公食邑三千戶賜紫贈司空諡大鑒
translation: The duke received a grant of 3,000 households and was given the purple color, and was given the title of secretary-general, "Great Confirmation.

source_sentence: 正號大廣智大興善寺三藏沙門
translation: Sanzang Shaman of Daxingshan Temple, Correctly Named Dagong Zhi
Amoghasiddhi Translation of the imperial edict
Thus I've heard.
One time, the Bhagavān was staying at Jeta Park in Śrāvastī.
He was staying at Jeta's Park in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 與大苾芻眾千二百五十人俱。
translation: He was accompanied by a large congregation of twelve hundred and fifty monks.
They were joined by countless bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and gods, dragons, nightjars, and the eight groups of people who gathered there.

source_sentence: 及天龍夜叉八部眾等皆來雲集。
translation: They were joined by countless bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, gods, dragons, nightjars, and the eight groups of people who had gathered there.
It was then that the Tathāgata addressed the crowd.
"I remember a time in the past.
I was staying north of Mount Snowdon and traveling up Fragrant Drunkenness Mountain.
I saw a young woman.
She had a body adorned with the appearance of a hundred blessings.
Deer skin was made into her clothing.
She wore a necklace made of poisonous snakes.
She gathered poisonous insects, tigers, and wolves as her lion.
She's surrounded by them from front to back and always has them as companions.
They drink juice made from poisonous fruit and eat fruit made from poisonous herbs.
When that woman saw me, she said.

source_sentence: 仁者聽我宣說一大真言。
translation: "Sir, listen to me as I declare this great true teaching.
It's able to remove all the poison in the world.

source_sentence: 若人聞此呪及念我名者。
translation: If someone hears this dhāraṇī and recites my name, they won't be harmed by all the poisons.
They won't be harmed by all the poisons.
The young woman then spoke the spell for me.
After I heard it, I always held onto it for the benefit of sentient beings.
I'll always hold this dhāraṇī for the benefit of sentient beings.
Now, I'll say this true saying.

source_sentence: 怛儞也他唵(引)壹哩蜜帝(引)底(丁壹反)哩蜜帝壹哩帝哩蜜帝(引)努迷努麼(引)哩(引)曳(引)訥泚訥蹉(引)哩曳得羯囉抳(尼貞反)嚩揭囉抳揭濕弭[口*(隸-木+士)](引)揭濕弭囉目訖帝(二合)惡祇惡伽儞惡伽娜惡伽曩伽儞壹哩曳壹哩壹哩曳阿佉夜(引)曳姶(烏合反)播夜曳濕吠帝(引)濕吠多頓嬭阿曩(引)努囉乞砂(二合)伺嚩(二合)訶佛言諸苾芻。
translation: 怛儞也他唵(引)壹哩蜜帝(引)底(丁壹反)哩蜜帝壹哩帝哩蜜帝(引)努迷努麼(引)哩(引)曳(引)訥泚訥蹉(引)哩曳得羯囉抳(尼貞反)嚩揭囉抳揭濕弭[口*(隸-木+士)](引)揭濕弭囉目訖帝(二合)惡祇惡伽儞惡伽娜惡伽曩伽儞壹哩曳壹哩壹哩曳阿佉夜(引)曳姶(烏合反)播夜曳濕吠帝(引)濕吠多頓嬭阿曩(引)努囉乞砂(二合)伺嚩(二合)訶佛言諸苾芻。
"Suppose someone hears this dhāraṇī for a moment.
He'll be freed from poison for the next seven years.
If a person always remembers it, then all poisonous insects and other poisons will be eliminated.

source_sentence: 一切毒虫及諸毒藥悉不能害。
translation: All poisonous insects and medicines won't harm him.
If a venomous snake comes to bite that person, the snake will rot.
The snake will immediately rot.
If someone accepts and upholds this dhāraṇī, they'll first offer something white to their teacher.
First, he must make an offering of something white to his teacher.
Then he'll accept it, and the Dharma will be accomplished.
Don't recite this dhāraṇī near a snake.

source_sentence: 其蛇即死死已令其甦活呪曰。
translation: The snake will then die, and after it dies, it will come back to life.

source_sentence: 怛儞也他伊哩彌哩誐囉彌左斫骨嚕斫骨魯斫骨論斫骨論誐囉彌抳句吒句吒曳帝娑普吒娑普吒曳帝那揭黎那伽折迦蘭底哩壹掣囉佛沙尸怛囉卑怛囉悉普吒悉普吒伺嚩(二合)訶若人念一遍。
translation: 怛儞也他伊哩彌哩誐囉彌左斫骨嚕斫骨魯斫骨論斫骨論誐囉彌抳句吒句吒曳帝娑普吒娑普吒曳帝那揭黎那伽折迦蘭底哩壹掣囉佛沙尸怛囉卑怛囉悉普吒悉普吒伺嚩(二合)訶若人念一遍。
Through the years, the poisons won't hit him.

source_sentence: 若能常持非言外毒消滅。
translation: If he can always recite it, it doesn't mean that external poisons will disappear.
It also removes the three internal poisons.
It's for ailments like bad sores and back problems.
If you spit on it, the recitation of the mantra will help.
All the bad animals that come along will be cured.

source_sentence: 但念七遍即過不能為害。
translation: Simply recite it seven times, and it'll pass away and become harmless.
If it causes poison, it'll be applied to the first knuckle on the top of the middle finger.

source_sentence: 處於中指上頭第一節文。
translation: Place the spell on the first verse of the upper middle finger.
Put your right and left hands around the sore.

source_sentence: 逆日轉念呪三七遍即差。
translation: Turn the mantra around three or seven times against the sun, and it will come off.
You must never raise your voice in constant chanting.
If you raise your voice, a venomous insect will surely die.
If a bad insect dies, then this spell will bring it back to life.
Use this dhāraṇī to relieve it and it will come back to life.
He recites the spell three or seven times.
The antidote to poisonous insects is this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞也他壹哩彌哩議哩那伽斫伽蘭底哩壹掣囉合沙鷄怛吒悉怛吒担吒悉怛吒伺嚩(二合)訶若人患發背。
translation: "Tāntiyata yi li mi li yi naga cakra randiri yi khala yi khala sa gandha siddhârtha siddhârtha siddhârtha svāhâvatāra (b.) If a person suffers from a flare-up, he'll be able to turn around and write upside down one turn against the sun.

source_sentence: 逆日轉遶倒書一匝即差。
translation: Turning against the sun, he circles around and writes backwards one turn, and then he's out.
That bad thing will spontaneously come out, and it's quite miraculous.
After the Buddha spoke these words, the crowd rejoiced and rose up at the appointed time.
The great multitude rejoiced and rose up at the appointed time.

source_sentence: 蘘麌哩曳童女銷伏毒害呪經
translation: Sutra on the Spell for Eliminating Poison and Harm by the Girl Kegurihiki
